data.text:
At Regent University, we aim to make your admissions process as easy as possible. Our counselors are ready to speak with you about your next steps based on your academic and career goals. Regent operates on a rolling admissions basis with fall and spring start dates for on-campus freshman applicants.Â

Here are five easy steps:Â

Apply to Regent University

Complete your admissions questionnaire

Submit your unofficial transcripts

Submit your government-issued ID if applicable

Submit your FAFSA

Whether transferring from a community college, other regionally accredited institution, or military career, Regent can help you maximize your transfer credits. With a generous transfer policy â up to 90 credit hours or up to 75% of a bachelorâs degree â 80% of students bring transfer credits to Regent. Up to $2,000 tuition grant for eligible transfer students from the Virginia Community College System.Â

Transfer with four easy steps:Â

Apply to Regent University

Submit your unofficial transcripts

Complete the admissions questionnaireÂ

Submit government-issued ID (only for online transfer students)
